intro: Dendranthema dichrum, commonly known as the double shrub chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring woody stems and lobed, hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a distinctive double-petaled structure that enhances its ornamental value. It is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
